topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d333026368724d83b40000#post_53d333026368724d83b40000
I already knew who that was.



Also looking back on history I think I've realized why in the long run so many "evil" rulers and such fail so often; cause they're dumb as fuck and are lead by dumb as fuck people who were chosen out of who they knew rather than their actual performance at their job.

Anyone with a brain would tell you not over-extend yourself militaristically.  You know how many dictators have not done this to some extent?  One; there's a reason why they call him Alexander "the great".  He conquered the entire known world.  That would be like if someone today were to conquer every scrap of land on the entire Earth.

The reason why in the long run Assad is fucked is that his forces do *NOT* have the manpower to retake the entire nation and he needs to take a knee, give up on the lands he's lost and play defensively.

As much as I dislike ISIS they're not stupid.  The areas they control they can control and rather than charging into Baghdad going "LEEROOYYYY JEEENNKIIINNNSSSSS!".  They know they need to control Baqubah before they can take Baghdad.

What is probably going to happen in the long run with ISIS is that they're going to form their own country that constitutes the right half of Syria and half of Iraq.

topics.body:

Opened a medical clinic where he treated patients for free. Converted to Christianity, and died of throat cancer at the age of 67.
Though, I do sense some possible regret in what he did. For a person who believed in his country, and being told to do something by his superiors who were absolute, he really couldn't have done much to avoid these atrocities.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d338ac63687242e4010000#post_53d338ac63687242e4010000
I know.


I know I'm going to get shit for this, *BUT* historically speaking if you want to take control of a government or conquer the world the proper way of doing it is to at first pick on people that can't put up a fight then when you conquer them leave their government intact where the main way you establish control is through promoting their economy and over time control more and more land and offering countries the chance to peacefully be taken over while minimizing damage done to their country.  If you destroy their country economically, religiously or government wise that will increase the chances of people rebelling.  If you go into a country and let them continue to govern themselves while doing things that promote a strong economy it's much harder to pin you as the bad guy.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d339366368724c89090000#post_53d339366368724c89090000
[bq="Randomosaur"]Uc9, any good tutorials on how to do cars, boats, planes, etc in Blender?[/bq]
That's pretty easy; you mainly start from boxes, cylinders or spheres then continuously extract and distort it until you have the object.  Basically for a car start with a box then add in vertexes, edges and such and keep extracting and so forth until you have a more car like shape.  At first it'll look junky, but 99% of the work is doing the itty bitty fine detal until it looks like a car.  Cars are easy to do; they just require a lot of patience to get the fine detail.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
